Wasm

Namespaces

  • Cache

Namespace Wasm\Cache

Module caching

Why would one like to cache WebAssembly modules? A particular usecase is the following: A WebAssembly module can be compiled ahead-of-time and stored in a cache, thus saving further compilations.

So far, only an on-disk cache exists with Wasm\Cache\Filesystem.

All cache implementations must implement the Wasm\Cache\CacheInterface interface. It relies on the PSR-16 specification for more simplicity and interoperability.

Modules as bytes, and vice versa

A Wasm\Module object can be serialized into a sequence of bytes. To serialize a module, use the native serialize PHP function, such as:

$module = new Wasm\Module('my_program.wasm');
$serialized_module = serialize($module);

To deserialize a sequence of bytes to a module, use the native unserialize PHP function.

Security note: The second argument of unserialize must be used to specify allowed classes to be deserialized, in this case Wasm\Module.

Let's see:

$module = unserialize($serialized_module, [Wasm\Module::class]);

Classes

  • Filesystem

    An on-disk cache implementation.

  • InvalidArgumentException

    Represents an invalid argument error for the cache implementations.

  • Exception

    Represents all errors for the cache implementations.

Interfaces

  • CacheInterface

    A cache interface that forces to implement PSR-16.
